mSloganSubtitle: A visual collaborative platform for your next, great projects.
mQuireDescription: The best collaborative project management software that actually helps teams get things done.
mHomeSectionDreamsDesc:
“There’s no path before me,
 and a track will be created behind me.”
- Takamura Kotaro
mHomeSectionStartSmallDesc:
We face a challenge by breaking it down. That is how our minds naturally work.
Quire lets you map out your thoughts, and tackle them with small steps.
mHomeSectionSublistDesc: Work on your tasks effortlessly with a more focused Sublist view. Make sure every team member is in control of their work.
mHomeSectionVisuallyDesc: Arrange, prioritize, and visualize the project with a Kanban board. Balance team resources to optimize efficiency and transparency
mHomeSectionTimelineDesc: Plan ahead with a versatile Gantt chart to schedule every milestone. Have a bird’s eye view of the project progress over time.
mHomeSectionProgressDesc: Listen to the pulse of your dreams. Understand the ups and downs of your tasks, your projects, and your team now and ahead. And celebrate success.
mHomeSectionSignupMidDesc:
Everything you need to go from ideas to action.
Sign up now. It's free!
mHomeSectionSignupBottomDesc:
Quire is here to walk your dreams home.
So go for it. And have fun!
mFeaturesSection1Title: All you need. [=linebreak]No more, no less.
mFeaturesSection1Desc:
Spend less time figuring out how things work.
Quire’s powerful features and intuitive design allow for project management harmony.
mFeaturesSectionSignupBottomDesc:
Everything you want and all you need to get things done.
See for yourself, sign up now.
mFeatureHierarchyDesc: Tackle big projects by breaking them down into small, manageable steps.
mFeatureBoardDesc: Visualize your workflow to better manage and focus on your tasks.
mFeatureTimelineDesc: Map out team schedule with a beautiful Gantt chart view, switchable between List and Board.
mFeatureSublistDesc: Create personalized sublists to get focused on the right tasks at the right time.
mFeatureMytasksDesc: Stay on top of tasks related to you across all projects.
mFeatureSmartFolderDesc: View, and organize tasks from different projects you chose in one place.
mFeatureExternalTeamDesc: Focus on your core tasks and assign those that are non-core to third parties easily and safely.
mFeatureTeamDesc: Share and delegate tasks to your friends and colleagues. See their modifications on your screen instantly.
mFeatureMessageDesc: See who said what about your tasks instantly.
mFeatureMultipleAssigneeDesc: Assign a task to the people responsible for it.
mFeatureRoleDesc: Grant different authorities to different members of your projects.
mFeatureShareLinkDesc: Send an invitation link to your clients so they can access your project without signup.
mFeatureShareDesc: Make your project public so anyone with that URL can see your project.
mFeatureDrilldownDesc: Focus on a task and see all its subtasks while filtering out everything else.
mFeatureGroupDesc: Sort your tasks to see those with the same assignee, priority, etc., together.
mFeatureFilterDesc: Filter your tasks to focus on a few crucial tasks and leave out the rest.
mFeatureBlinkSearchDesc: Find any project, organization or member you want in an instant.
mFeatureThemesDesc: Switch to a light, or dark theme for the comfort of your eyes.
mFeatureHealthStatsDesc: A visual overview of how well each of your projects and members is performing.
mFeatureRecurringDesc: Get your routines in your task tree once and for all.
mFeaturePeekabooDesc: Temporarily tuck away your currently non-actionable tasks to better organize your task list and avoid stress at work.
mFeatureTimeDesc: Set start and due dates and time to clearly indicate the schedule of the task.
mFeatureRemindersDesc: Get reminded of upcoming tasks before start or due whenever you want across devices.
mFeatureNotificationDesc: Get notified of updates on what you care about and when.
mFeatureFavoriteDesc: Give a thumbs up, vote for a task, or focus on those that matter to you personally. With ❤.
mFeatureFollowersDesc: Follow tasks to get notified of any changes made to them automatically.
mFeatureMobileAppDesc: Work seamlessly on your iPhone and iPad whenever, wherever.
mFeatureSiriDesc: Your smart assistant that helps you manage tasks using just your voice.
mFeatureAndroidDesc: Pick up where you left off on your Android phone. Even offline.
mFeatureGoogleEmailDesc: Turn your Google emails into Quire tasks simultaneously.
mFeatureGoogleCalendarDesc: See your tasks as events on Google, iCal or Outlook Calendar and get notified.
mFeatureGoogleAssistantDesc: Manage your tasks list with a voice-controlled virtual assistant.
mFeatureSlackDesc: Get updates about your projects in a Slack channel and more.
mFeatureZapierDesc: Connect Quire instantly with 2,000+ apps to automate your workflow and find productivity super powers.
mFeatureMsTeamsDesc: Connect team’s conversations to Quire task lists.
mFeatureIntegraGithubDesc: Keep everyone on your team up to date with the code changes by linking commits to your tasks.
mFeatureChromeExtensionDesc: Quickly access Quire and get notified from any web page in Chrome.
mFeatureNameStyleDesc: Highlight your tasks and projects by adding color, bold and more.
mFeatureShortcutsDesc: Tons of nifty shortcuts for shortcut addicts without touching your mouse.
mFeatureSmartAddDesc: Quickly assign a member, tag, priority, etc., to a task with smart keyboard shortcuts.
mFeatureBatchOPDesc: Make changes, such as assigning a member and tag, to all your selected tasks at once.
mFeatureTemplateDesc: Save time - duplicate a project or task to use as a template.
mFeatureImportDesc: Pain-free moving from your current project management software to Quire.
mFeatureExportDesc: Convert your project data into CSV to edit it in Excel, or into JSON for further processing and back up.
mFeaturePasteDesc: Copy your contents from other apps like Word, Excel and Email and paste as tasks in Quire.
mFeatureGoogleDriveDesc: Easily upload a file or attach a file from Google Drive to your tasks.
mFeatureOpenAPIDesc: Let you build scripts and integrate your favorite applications with Quire.
mFeatureAppDirectoryDesc: Boost up your productivity with some top-notch integrations.
mPricingPageTitle: Get the right resources for your team
mPricingPageSubtitle: Whether you are a small team or an enterprise-grade organization, we have all the resources available to you.
mPricingPlanFreeDesc: For individuals or teams just getting started with Quire and need to keep track of their work
mPricingPlanFreeFeatures:
• 5 projects
  • 10 members
  • 50 MB storage
  • Unlimited Nested Task List
  • Kanban Board
  • Project Overview
  • Permission Control
  • iOS and Android mobile apps
  • Integrations with your favorite apps
mPricingPlanProDesc: For small teams up to [=members] team members that need to visualize their work in one place
mPricingPlanProFeatures:
• Up to 20 members
  • 10 GB storage
  • Dynamic Timeline
  • Grid View
  • 5 Sublists
  • 6 Smart Folders
  • 3 External Teams
  • Share Project
  • Peekaboo
  • 5 Multiple Assignees
  • Priority support
mPricingPlanPremDesc: For growing teams or companies with cross-functional teams and more complex workflows
mPricingPlanPremFeatures:
• 30 GB storage
  • 15 Sublists
  • 20 Smart Folders
  • 10 External Teams
  • Master Organization
  • Unlimited Multiple Assignee
  • Training / Consultancy
mPricingPlanEntDesc: For enterprise-grade corporates that need ultimate management, security control and support
mPricingPlanEntFeatures:
• Unlimited projects
  • 3 GB storage per member or custom
  • Unlimited Sublist
  • Unlimited Smart Folder
  • Unlimited External Teams
  • Premium Support
mPricingPlanEntNote: *Need a more customized plan or further assistance? Contact us
mPricingNonprofitDesc: Your job is to focus on making the world a better place, our job is to provide you with a reliable platform for you to start working on your dreams. Apply for our Nonprofits and Educational discount programs.
mPricingCompanyDesc: Over 100,000 teams have celebrated success with us!
mPricingFaqQ1: Can I use Quire for free forever with no strings attached?
mPricingFaqA1: Absolutely! Don’t worry about the pricing if you’re just a solo flyer or you just collaborate within a small group of members! Quire can be completely free to use! The Free plan does have some limitations, however you can upgrade your subscription plan anytime you want!
mPricingFaqA2: Yes! You can explore the ultimate experiences with Quire by trying the Premium, Professional and Enterprise plans for free for 30 days!
mPricingFaqA3: Quire charges you a fee per user. If you upgrade to a paid plan, the final price will be calculated based on how many members in your organization. Please note that External teams members are also counted toward organization members.
mPricingFaqQ4: Master Org? How do you charge if I have multiple repeating users?
mPricingFaqA4: If you have multiple organizations that share exactly same team members, you can avoid being overcharged by using Master Organization to link all of the organizations together and get billed once under one Master Organization.
mPricingFaqQ5: Do you have monthly and yearly billing options?
mPricingFaqA5: Yes! The annual billing cycle is approximately 20% cheaper than the monthly billing option for all of the plans.
mPricingFaqQ6: What forms of payment do you accept?
mPricingFaqA6: You can purchase Quire with any major credit card and Paypal. For annual subscriptions with Enterprise plan, we can issue an invoice payable by bank transfer. Please contact us to arrange an invoice purchase. Please note that Quire payment process is conducted by our online reseller Paddle. Paddle is the Merchant of Record for all our orders. Paddle provides all customer service payment inquiries.
mPricingFaqQ7: Can I upgrade from Professional to Premium or to Enterprise plan at any time?
mPricingFaqA7: Yes! You can enjoy the new quotas and features of the higher plan immediately. When you upgrade your current plan or add more members to your organization, your account will be charged a prorated amount based on the percentage of the billing cycle left at the time you made the change.
mPricingFaqQ8: Can I change the billing cycle?
mPricingFaqA8: Yes! The change will reflect in the next billing cycle.
mPricingFaqQ9: Can I downgrade my current plan at any time?
mPricingFaqA9: Yes! If you choose to downgrade your paid subscription plan to another lower-tier paid subscription plan or remove users from your Quire organization, the credits will be issued to your billing account based on the percentage of the billing cycle left at the time you made the change. The credits will only be used when making new purchases. If you choose to cancel your subscription plan, we will not issue any credits. You cannot transfer the credits to another organization as well.
mPricingFaqQ10: Can I cancel my payment plan?
mPricingFaqA10: Yes! If you decide to cancel your payment plan, the changes will be reflected in the next billing cycle. You can continue using your current subscription until expired.
mPricingFaqA11: No. We don't offer refunds. After cancelling the subscription plan, you can continue using Quire until the end of your then-current billing period.
mPricingContactSalesTitle: We are here to help! Start using Quire today.
mPricingLinkFaq: Still have more questions? Contact us.
mQuotaKeptTaskDaysTip: Removed tasks will be kept in Trash for [=n] days across all plans
mQuotaSublistsTip: Private Sublist will not be counted toward this limitation
mQuotaKeptDaysDetail: [=n] removed organizations or projects kept in Trash
mPlanFeatureShareProjectTip: Share projects to non-signed up users. These users will not be counted toward organization members
mPlanFeaturePeekabooTip: Peekabooed tasks will be tucked away until you're ready to handle them
mPlanFeatureImportTip: CSV, JSON (Asana, Trello, ToDoist), and clipboard
mPlanSupportFreeHoursTip: Free only when having more than [=n] members
mPlanSupportContractTip: Only available for Customized Enterprise plan
mFromEmailAddressDesc: Must be school email addresses and preferably the email address that was used to sign up for your Quire account
mFromWorkingEmailDesc: preferably the email address that was used to sign up for your Quire account
mFromUpload501abel: Please upload a valid 501(c)(3) or similar documentation
mFromUploadFileDesc: Maximum file size is [=size]. Images and PDF formats supported only.
mFromPlanOtherHelpLabel: Anything we can assist you with?
mFromCustomEnterpriseHelpDesc: If you would like to upgrade your subscription plan to Custom Enterprise, please write in details your requested numbers of users, storage size, numbers of projects and other quotas.
mFromUsingDurationLabel: Please provide a brief summary of how you plan and how long you are going to use Quire with your student groups
mFromStudentsAmountLabel: How many students are you going to have in your Quire organization?
mFromStorageQuotaLabel: How much quota storage are you going to need for your Quire organization?
mFromOtherQuotaLabel: What else do you need for your Quire organization?
mFromQuotaExampleDesc: such as: number of sublists, number of projects, etc.
mFromStudentIDLabel: Please provide a valid student ID card.
mCookieGDPRDesc: We use cookies to ensure that we give you the best experience on our website.
mSecurityPageDesc:
At Quire, we work very hard to ensure your data to be safe, secure and private.
Your tasks, projects and personal information are safe with us, and we want you to know how we're handling it.
mSecurityEncryptionDesc: At Quire, we take personal data protection very serious. We want you to rest assured that your personal data will be carefully handled and protected with Quire. You can check out our policy page. All traffic on Quire runs on SSL/TLS, the most powerful and trusted protocol for secure communications.
mSecurityStorageDesc: Your data is stored in the United States by Amazon Web Services (AWS), and is backed up continuously with copies stored in an off-site location for disaster recovery. This highly secure AWS infrastructure deploys a physical security program with SSAE 16 certification. For more information, please visit AWS Cloud Security.
mSecurityBackupDesc: You will be completely in control of your data on Quire platform (to access, transfer, export and delete the data). You can backup your data to your local drive on your own at anytime. When a user decides to leave Quire and delete his or her account, all of the data will be removed from Quire platform completely without having any other hidden copy without user’s permission. No one is allowed to access the data without written permission, and we only ask if it is really necessary to solve client-related issues.
mSecurityPriorityDesc: We always make sure that our users are aware of their control over their personal data. We do not share personally identifiable information with third parties. Quire commits to be transparent and straightforward without any hidden agendas about the use of users’ personal data.
mTutorialDesc:
Welcome on board!
Excited to kick off your projects? Here are a few quick steps to help you get started in Quire.
mTutorialAddProjectContent:
Your awesome project deserves a name. If it already has one, you can skip this step.

Let’s say you want to organize a charity run to fight children starvation across the world. You can call it: Children’s Run for Charity 2018.

To add a project, click on the "+" icon in the upper-right of your workspace.
mTutorialAddTaskContent:
Be it ideas, notes or to dos, you can dump them all as tasks or subtasks.

  • To add tasks — Click on the "+" icon at the top, or simply press shortcut ‘t’. Press Enter and continue pressing it to add more.
  • To add subtasks — Press Tab to make task a subtask.
  • To stop adding — Press Esc.

Just like how you would in a Word processor!
mTutorialSetDueContent:
A task without a deadline tends to slip through your fingers.

To add a due date, click on the "date" icon of a task in the task list.
mTutorialAssigneeContent:
You have a task called Sponsors. But who is responsible for finding them?

To assign a task to someone, click on the "assignee" icon of the task, and enter his or her email.

Note: That person will receive an invitation in his or her email inbox.

[=img]

Tip: You can assign a task to multiple people by hovering their names and clicking on the "+" on the right of each name.
mTutorialTagContent:
You can give tasks additional context or group them.

For example, you can add tags called Sponsors, Venue and Promotion in colors red, green and blue to related tasks.

To add tags, click on the "tag" icon of a task, and enter the tag name.
mTutorialTagTip: Tip: You can filter tasks by tag(s) to see only a group of tasks with that tag(s).
mTutorialAutocompleteContent:
What if you can add and assign everything, all at once?

When you add a task, you can type <> to add deadline, @ to add an assignee, and # to add a tag, etc. Like this: "Come up with a list of promotional items <Friday> @David #Promotion".
mTutorialDetailPanelContent:
Many times, a task needs a bit more information to be carried out smoothly.

You can add details — including description and attachments — to the task after clicking on "<<"in the upper right corner. You can also discuss, chat and interact with members in comments there in the detail panel.

To add styles to your description or comment (eg., make it bold), check out Markdown.
mTutorialDetailPanelTip: Tip: You can click on the "pin" icon to keep the detail panel open.
mTutorialDragTaskContent:
What happens if you have tasks that have fallen to the wrong place?

In Quire, you can drag & drop them to where they rightfully belong. For example, move giveaways like T-shirts, bumper stickers and water bottles to under task "Promotional Items."
mTutorialShortcutContent:
Add & Edit

  • Enter — To add a new task.
  • F2 — To edit the task name.

Navigation

  • ↑ — To go to the task above.
  • ↓ — To go to the task below.
  • Space — To open the right detail panel.

Multi-Selection

  • Shift + ↑/↓ — To select multiple tasks.
  • Ctrl + A — To select all tasks.

Move

  • Ctrl + ↑/↓ — To move tasks up or down.
  • Ctrl + ←/→ — To move tasks left or right, aka a level up or down.

Task Action

  • Ctrl + M — To assign a selected task(s) to yourself.
  • Ctrl + / — To complete the selected task(s).
  • Ctrl + Z — To show the Undo window.

Copy & Paste

  • Ctrl + C — To copy selected task(s).
  • Ctrl + V — To paste selected task(s).
  • Ctrl + X — To cut selected task(s).
mTutorialQuickAssignContent:
To quickly set assignee, tag, etc. without the mouse, press @, #, <, !, ^, >, / on the keyboard when task(s) are selected.

  • @ — Add assignee
  • # — Add tag
  • < — Add due date
  • ! — Set priority
  • ^ — Add to a sublist view
  • > — Transfer to a project
  • / — Set status
mTutorialContextmenuContent:
You can right-click on a task, to bring up the context menu to set due date, assignee, tag, and more.

[=img]

[=tip]

Now that you know your way around, you can kickstart your project!
mTutorialContextmenuTip: Tip: You can press F1 to see a complete list of keyboard shortcuts.
mListTutorialLinkTitle: Break down big projects into smaller tasks with Quire Nested Tree
mBoardTutorialLinkTitle: Streamline workflow visually with Quire Kanban Board
mSublistTutorialLinkTitle: Get focused on the right tasks with a personalized Quire Sublist
mTimelineTutorialLinkTitle: Map out project schedule with Quire Timeline
mSignupToday: Let's get started in Quire today!
mBoardTutorialDesc: Get the bird’s eye view of your project with a flexible yet powerful Kanban board. Visualize the team's progress and move forward to success!
mBoardTutorialSwitchBoardViewTitle: Switch to Board View From Tree
mBoardTutorialSwitchBoardViewContent:
On the top right corner of your Tree view, choose the “Board” icon.

[=img]

You can use the Filter icon to filter out the tasks that you want to select or use the Search function to find the tasks. Then click “Create” to enter your Board view for this Sublist.
mBoardTutorialReorderColumnsContent: In case you don’t like the default order of your columns in Board view, you can grab the column header and start moving the column to a new destination.
mBoardTutorialCreateTaskTitle: Create a Task in Board View
mBoardTutorialCreateTaskContent:
There are two ways to create a task in Board view:

    1. You can select an existing task on a column and press “Enter” to create a new same-level task or “Shift + Enter” to create a subtask that links to the chosen existing parent task.

      2. [=video]

    2. In the bottom corner of each column, click “Add tasks'' then start typing in your task name and any parameters (i.g. Assignee, priority , etc.). Then press enter to save your new task.
mBoardTutorialCreateTaskTip: Tip: Take advantage of the inline assign function to save time when adding new parameters to a task.
mBoardTutorialTrackProgressContent:
You can reposition tasks in the column for higher priority. Also, you can drag and drop tasks to different columns for progress tracking.

Now, you will be able to see the dynamic status of your project at a glance.
mBoardTutorialTrackProgressTip: Tips: Note that if you choose to sort your tasks by name or group your task by Update Per Week or Complete Per Week, you cannot drag to reorder them.
mBoardTutorialAddMoreDetailTitle: Add More Details to Board View
mBoardTutorialAddMoreDetailContent:
You could add more detailed information by setting start/due dates, assignees, and tags.

Click on the “date”, “assignee”, “tag” icons to set additional information.
mBoardTutorialAddMoreDetailTip: Tip: By pressing the Spacebar, the detail panel will show up for you to add descriptions, attach files, leave comments, etc.
mBoardTutorialSwimlaneTitle: Get to Know Kanban Board Swimlane
mBoardTutorialSwimlaneContent:
Feeling like all the tasks are squished into one column and it’s getting harder to get a hold of the workload and status of each team member?

You can use filter and sort features to group your tasks by the preferred attributes. For example: grouped by assignees to see each members' responsible tasks.
mBoardTutorialShuffleColumnContent:
Your default Board view is grouped by status. Each column represents an unique stage of your project and the circle next to the column header represents the percentage of its stage.

If you don’t want to group your tasks by status, click on the “Board” icon again to choose a different way to visualize your tasks.

[=img]

Within each column, the tasks are grouped together in the same order with your Tree view. You can reorder the tasks up and down or move the tasks across columns by dragging them.
mBoardTutorialShortcutContent:
Add & Edit

  • Enter — To add a new task.
  • F2 — To edit the task name.

Navigation

  • ↑ — To go to the task above.
  • ↓ — To go to the task below.
  • Space — To open the right detail panel.

Multi-Selection

  • Shift + ↑/↓ — To select multiple tasks.
  • Ctrl + A — To select all tasks.

Move

  • Ctrl + ↑/↓ — To move tasks up or down.
  • Ctrl + ←/→ — To move tasks left or right, aka column to column.

Note: When the board is sorted by date, you would not be able to move tasks from one swimlane to another.

Task Action

  • Ctrl + M — To assign a selected task(s) to yourself.
  • Ctrl + / — To complete the selected task(s).
  • Ctrl + Z — To show the Undo window.

Copy & Paste

  • Ctrl + C — To copy selected task(s).
  • Ctrl + V — To paste selected task(s).
  • Ctrl + X — To cut selected task(s).
mBoardTutorialQuickAssignContent:
To quickly set assignee, tag, etc. without the mouse, press @, #, <, !, ^, >, / on the keyboard when task(s) are selected.

  • @ — Add assignee
  • # — Add tag
  • < — Add due date
  • ! — Set priority
  • ^ — Add to a sublist view
  • > — Transfer to a project
  • / — Set status
mBoardTutorialContextmenuContent: You can right-click on a task, to bring up the context menu to set due date, assignee, tag, and more.
mBoardTutorialYourBoardContent: That's all we have to talk about Kanban board for now. Go ahead and have fun!
mSublistTutorialDesc:
Dealing with an ever-growing shared task list between team members has never been easier with Quire Sublist!
Select several important tasks and add them to a personalized sublist so you can focus on the right tasks at the right time, without any distraction.
mSublistTutorialAddSublistContent:
Tired of looking at the list with no end in sight? There are too many tasks that are not relevant to you but you cannot Peekaboo to tuck them away because other members are still working on those tasks. A sublist is here to the rescue!

To add a sublist, click on the “+” button and create a sublist.
mSublistTutorialAddSublistTip: Tip: You can create as many sublists as you want for a project.
mSublistTutorialPickTaskTitle: Select the Right Tasks and Add to Sublist
mSublistTutorialPickTaskContent:
Let’s say you are working on a "Children\'s Run for Charity" project that involves hundreds of tasks. There are at least 10 people who collaborate together. You cannot keep creating different tags to organize the tasks that you are in charge of. You cannot Peekaboo to tuck away the irrelevant tasks because other team members still need to view them.

Take a deep breath and create your first sublist to solve your problem. Simply select the important tasks which you want to view together and move to a separate list. Now you have your own to do list to focus on, without getting distracted by everything else.

[=img]

When creating a sublist, in the below task list menu, you can choose either to “Include” the selected tasks or “Exclude” the selected tasks.

When you select the root task and add to the sublist, its subtasks will automatically be added to the list.

However, you can choose to select the subtasks separately from the root task and add to the newly created sublist.

To differentiate the newly created sublist with the master list, you can add some fun icons and change the icon color to your sublist.
mSublistTutorialShareTitle: Share the Sublist with the Right People
mSublistTutorialShareContent: After choosing the tasks and adding to a sublist, you can also choose with whom you want to share the sublist with. There are three options for you to choose from: share with an External Team, share with all of the Project Members or keep the sublist private for yourself.
mSublistTutorialSmartNavigationContent:
There’s no limitation for how many sublists that you can create for a project. Each sublist serves as a customized list view for you to get focused and organize your tasks.

When you are having too many sublists, you might want to pin the most used sublists (and even boards!) for quick navigation between the main list and its subordinates and coordinators.
mSublistTutorialSmartNavigationTip: Tip: You can always move the sublist tabs around to arrange their positions.
mSublistTutorialOrganizeTitle: Organize the Tasks between Different Sublists
mSublistTutorialOrganizeContent:
What if you want to arrange the tasks between several sublists?

Simply drag and drop the tasks to move them to another sublist for better organization. When you drop a chunk of tasks into another sublist, the tree structure between them will be kept as original.

[=img]

When you are working on your sublist, since it behaves as a mirror of the main list, whatever the changes you make for one of your sublists, it will affect your main list.

If you want to navigate quickly between views, use the shortcut "(" or ")"
mSublistTutorialOrganizeTip: Tip: You can always switch back to the main list to view the big picture of your project!
mSublistTutorialTodoTitle: Tackle an Overwhelming To-do List as a Winning Team
mSublistTutorialTodoContent:
Don’t let the stress of an ever-growing to-do list beat you and your team productivity! Productivity is all about getting focused on the right thing at the right time!

Now go get things done and achieve your dreams!
mTimelineTutorialDesc: Having troubles spotting roadblocks with your project? With only one tap, switch your task list into a Timeline view and start visualizing your project with an easy-to-understand time frame.
mTimelineTutorialSwitchViewTitle: Switch to Timeline View from Tree View
mTimelineTutorialSwitchViewContent: On the upper right corner, you will see three buttons that associate with different views of your project and sublists. Click on the Timeline button to switch your project into a Gantt Chart (Timeline) view and all of your tasks will map out their deadlines.
mTimelineTutorialSwitchViewTip: Tip: Each task list has its own Tree view, Board view and Timeline view.
mTimelineTutorialNestedListTitle: View Timeline Side-by-side with Nested Task List
mTimelineTutorialNestedListContent:
Your main screen will be divided into two views: on the left side is the nested task list that keeps you in context and on the right side is the Timeline view. You can resize the task list by hovering over the separating line between the list and the Timeline view.

[=img1]

If your task has been scheduled before (either having a start date or a due date), there will be a dot at the end of the task that indicates there’s a time frame associated with this task. Click on the dot to quickly slide to the task timespan bar.

[=img2]

[=tip]

You can reorder the task list by dragging the task itself or grabbing the timespan bar to rearrange the task order.
mTimelineTutorialNestedListTip: Tip: You can click on the dropdown menu next to the project name and choose “Enter full screen” to view more details in the Timeline.
mTimelineTutorialAddTaskTitle: Add New Tasks in Timeline View
mTimelineTutorialAddTaskContent: Open the nested task list and select an existing task then press “Enter” to create a new same-level task, or “Shift + Enter” to create a subtask.
mTimelineTutorialAddTaskTip: Tip: You can choose to hide the nested list view after creating a new task to expand the Timeline view.
mTimelineTutorialRescheduleContent:
It’s ideal when all of the deadlines are met, but sometimes life gets in the way. That’s why you should always rearrange your schedule to better manage the project bandwidth.

If you want to see the duration of your task, you can hover on the timespan bar and the task’s schedule will be shown under the timespan bar.

Simply hover over the start or due date of the task and extend or shorten the time duration. You can click to move or drag the whole bar altogether.

[=img]

[=tip]

Made mistakes? No worries, you can always click on the Undo button in the upper corner and undo your move.
mTimelineTutorialRescheduleTip: Tip: If you’re not so confident with the dragging and dropping the timespan bar, you can actually change the start or due date at the grid column or in the task’s detail panel.
mTimelineTutorialColorTitle: Color Timeline View in Any Way You Want
mTimelineTutorialColorContent:
Timeline is mainly for visualizing, so it’s important to let each task stand out visually. You can choose to color your tasks by priority, tag, date or just leave it as none.

[=img]

[=tip]

If a parent task has a different duration as its subtasks, in Timeline view, the timespan bar of the parent task will also mark as a grayed slashed bar that covers the time duration of the subtasks as well.
mTimelineTutorialColorTip: Tip: The colors meanings can be found in this detailed guide.
mTimelineTutorialGridViewTitle: Customize Task List with Grid View
mTimelineTutorialGridViewContent:
Since the timeline view can only show very limited details of the task list, you can tap on the timeline button and toggle on Grid View.

You can choose which task details you would like to show on your list, the default selections are “Status”, “Priority”, “Assignee”, “Tags”, “Start”, and “Due”. After choosing which option you want to show, you can resize the column if needed.
mTimelineTutorialNavigateContent:
• Multi-select tasks by using “Shift” and reschedule them all at once.
  • Grab on the calendar header and move right or left.
  • Click on the “Today” button on the upper right corner to jump to Today date.
  • Change the timeline view to Day view, Week view, Month view, Year view and choose to show weekends or not.
  • Use Filter to sort and group your timeline in however order you may like. You can choose to view your timeline by task status, assignees, or priority.

Now you have learned everything about Quire Timeline and ready to achieve your next project milestone! Go wild and have fun!
